intro: Oldenlandia tomentosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf or creeping jenny, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves and clusters of small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forest floors or wetlands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. Oldenlandia tomentosa is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
